title: Pure Storage: Fiscal 1Q Earnings Snapshot
text:
MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif. (AP) _ Pure Storage Inc. (PSTG) on Monday reported a loss of $64.3 million in its fiscal first quarter.
On a per-share basis, the Mountain View, California-based company said it had a loss of 29 cents. Losses, adjusted for stock option expense and amortization costs, were 7 cents per share.
The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of nine analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for a loss of 12 cents per share.
The data storage company posted revenue of $255.9 million in the period, also topping Street forecasts. Six analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $251.5 million.
For the current quarter ending in August, Pure Storage said it expects revenue in the range of $296 million to $304 million.
The company expects full-year revenue in the range of $1.32 billion to $1.37 billion.
Pure Storage shares have climbed 49 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Monday, shares hit $23.61, more than doubling in the last 12 months.
